00022 /**
00023  * @file   QuantMethodExprChipSummary.h
00024  * @author Alan Williams
00025  * 
00026  * @brief Summarize basic statistics on the performance of
00027  * a particular summarization or detection method across a number of
00028  * cel files.
00029  */
00030 #ifndef _QUANTMETHODEXPRCHIPSUMMARY_H_
00031 #define _QUANTMETHODEXPRCHIPSUMMARY_H_
00032 
00033 //
00034 #include "chipstream/ChipSummary.h"
00035 #include "chipstream/CumulativeStats.h"
00036 #include "chipstream/MetaProbeset.h"
00037 #include "chipstream/ProbeSet.h"
00038 #include "chipstream/QuantExprMethod.h"
00039 #include "chipstream/QuantMethodExprReport.h"

00041 #include "file/TsvFile/TsvFile.h"

00050 /**
00051  * Summarize basic statistics on the performance of a
00052  * particular summarization or detection method across a number of cel
00053  * files. Detection based methods output the percentage above a certain
00054  * score. Summarization methods output the average and stdev for
00055  * summarized values, RLE (relative log expression), and MAD (median
00056  * absolute residual) when method provides residuals.
00057  * 
00058  */
00059 class QuantMethodExprChipSummary : public QuantMethodExprReport, public ChipSummary {
00060 
00061 public :
00062 
00063   /** Constructor. */
00064   QuantMethodExprChipSummary(const std::vector<std::string> &chipNames,
00065                              bool doThreshold, double minThreshold, double maxThreshold,
00066                              std::string qccFile,
00067                              std::vector<MetaProbeset *> &metaSets);
00068 
00069   /** 
00070    * Get set up for a run of reporting probesets. 
00071    * @param qMethod - Quantification method to be used.
00072    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00073    */
00074   bool prepare(QuantMethod &qMethod, const IntensityMart &iMart);
00075 
00076   /** 
00077    * After every probeset computation this function is called an is an opportunity
00078    * to query the quantification method for results, residuals, etc.
00079    * @param psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
00080    * @param qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.
00081    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00082    */  
00083   bool report(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, QuantMethod &qMethod,
00084               const IntensityMart &iMart, std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, 
00085               PmAdjuster &pmAdjust);
00086 
00087   /** 
00088    * Finish outputting results and clean up.
00089    * @param qMethod - Quantification method that was used.
00090    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00091    */
00092   bool finish(QuantMethod &qMethod);
00093 
00094 private :
00095   /** 
00096    * Load up the groups from a simple tab delimited text file. Need to
00097    * have a column called 'group_name' and then at least one column
00098    * named 'probeset_id' or 'probeset_name'. If groups called
00099    * 'pos_control' and 'neg_control' are both supplied then the AUC
00100    * from the ROC is estimated and reported as well. Looks something
00101    * like:
00102    *
00103    * \verbatim
00104      group_name   probeset_name
00105      pos_control  AFFX-123
00106      pos_control  AFFX-456
00107      neg_control  AFFX-789
00108      \endverbatim
00109    * @param fileName - path to text file to read from.
00110    * @param doThreshold - Should we be doing thresholding (detection based)?
00111    * @param minThreshold - Minimum value to pass threshold.
00112    * @param maxThreshold - Maximum value to pass threshold.
00113    */
00114   void readGroupsFile(const std::string &fileName, bool doThreshold, 
00115                       double minThreshold, double maxThreshold,
00116                       std::set<std::string> &psToRun);
00117 
00118   /**
00119    * @brief Class for function predicate, to sort pairs by the first coordinate,
00120    * or the second coordinate if the first coordinates are equal.
00121    */
00122   class CoordSort {
00123   public:
00124     bool operator() (const std::pair<float, float>* p1, const std::pair<float, float>* p2) const;
00125   };
00126 
00127   /**
00128    * Keep track of intensity, RLE and MAD statistics for probesets that
00129    * are provided iteratively via the report() function.
00130    */
00131   class ProbeSetGroupStats {
00132     
00133   public:
00134     
00135     /** 
00136      * Constructor. If the groupNames is empty then
00137      * all probesets are included in statistics.
00138      */
00139     ProbeSetGroupStats(const std::string &name, uint32_t numChips, 
00140                        bool cacheData, bool doThreshold,
00141                        double minThreshold, 
00142                        double maxThreshold,
00143                        const std::set<std::string> &groupNames);
00144     /** 
00145      * Check to see if we are including a particular ProbeSetGroup in
00146      * our statistics.
00147      * @param psGroup - ProbeSetGroup to check for inclusion.
00148      * @return bool - true if should be included, false otherwise.
00149      */
00150     bool inGroup(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup);
00151     
00152     /** 
00153      * Given a probeset group, extract and keep track of summary data
00154      * statistics.
00155      * @param qMethod - The quantification method to extract statistics from.
00156      */
00157     void report(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, QuantExprMethod &qMethod);
00158 
00159     std::string m_Name; ///< Symbolic name for this group of probe sets.
00160     bool m_DoThreshold;  ///< Should we just do counts of things that pass threshold? 
00161     double m_MinThreshold; ///< What is the minimum threshold? Anything >= to this is accepted.
00162     double m_MaxThreshold; ///< What is the maximum threshold? Anything <= to this is accepted.
00163     uint32_t m_PsCount; ///< How many probeset groups have we seen?
00164     uint32_t m_AtomCount; ///< How many pm probes have been used?
00165     bool m_CacheData; ///< Are we keeping around the data for later examination?
00166     std::set<std::string> m_ValidNames; ///< What names should be included in this group.
00167     std::vector<CumulativeStats<double> > m_Summaries; ///< Summary for each chip.
00168     std::vector<CumulativeStats<double> > m_RLEs; ///< Relative log expression for each chip to median.
00169     std::vector<CumulativeStats<double> > m_MADs; ///< Median absolute residual for each chip.
00170     std::vector<std::vector<float> > m_Data; ///< Data cache for each chip, if requested.
00171   }; /* end of ProbeSetGroupStats class */
00172 
00173   /** 
00174    * Add a group that we wish to keep statistics for. If a probeset's name is in
00175    * the name set the results for that probeset will be added to the summary
00176    * stats. If both the name set is empty it acts as a wildcard and
00177    * statistics are kept for every probeset.
00178    * 
00179    * @param name - Reference name for this group.
00180    * @param cacheData - Should we keep the data in RAM as we go? (i.e. for ROC curve).
00181    * @param names - Set containing names of probesets to be kept.
00182    * @param doThreshold - Should we be doing thresholding (detection based)?
00183    * @param minThreshold - Minimum value to pass threshold.
00184    * @param maxThreshold - Maximum value to pass threshold.
00185    * @param isPosControl - Should this group of stats be considered a positive control
00186    * @param isNegControl - Should this group of stats be considered a negative control
00187    */
00188   void addGroupStat(const std::string &name, 
00189                     bool cacheData,
00190                     const std::set<std::string> &names,
00191                     bool doThreshold, double minThresh, double maxThresh,
00192                     bool isPosControl, bool isNegControl);
00193   
00194   /** 
00195    * Calculate the area under the ROC curve generated by the scores
00196    * for the positive and negative vectors. This code comes directly from
00197    * Peter's translation of the original exact perl code
00198    * @param pos - Vector of scores for positive examples.
00199    * @param neg - Vector of scores for negative examples.
00200    * @return - Estimate of area under the ROC curve.
00201    */
00202   double calcAuc(std::vector<float> &pos, std::vector<float> &neg, bool increasing = true);
00203 
00204 private :
00205   /// Name for each of our chips.
00206   std::vector<std::string> m_ChipNames;
00207   /// Index of positive and negative controls in stats if they exist.
00208   int32_t m_posControlIx, m_negControlIx;
00209   /// Are we going to process pos and negative controls?
00210   bool m_HaveNegControls, m_HavePosControls;
00211   /// Our sets of probesets that we are keeping statistics for.
00212   std::vector<ProbeSetGroupStats> m_Stats;
00213   /// Is this run report using thresholds (i.e. detection)?
00214   bool m_DoThreshold;
00215   /// Map probeset IDs to probeset names for those probesets which go into summary stats
00216   std::map<std::string, std::string > m_QuantInHeader;
00217   /// Map probeset IDs/names to what group for those going into header
00218   std::map<std::string, std::string > m_QuantInHeaderGroup;
00219   /// Order of qc probesets in header
00220   std::vector<std::string> m_QcPsNameVec;
00221   /// Signal estimates for QC probesets to report in header
00222   std::vector<std::vector<double> > m_QcPsResults;
00223   /// Which QC probesets for the header did we actually process
00224   std::vector<std::string> m_QcPsSeen;
00225 };

00227 #endif /* _QUANTMETHODEXPRCHIPSUMMARY_H_ */
